newsitem.title: USA: Kmart April same store sales off.
newsitem.headline: Kmart April same store sales off.

text.p: Kmart Corp said Thursday same store sales for the four weeks ended April 30 fell 0.8 percent on a consolidated basis.
U.S. Kmart same-store sales in April also fell 0.8 percent.
Results exclude sales of the discontinued Builders Square operations.
Kmart reported total consolidated sales for the four weeks ended April 30 of $2.268 billion, down 2.2 percent from $2.319 billion for the same period last year.

Sales from consolidated operations for the 13 weeks ended April 30 were $7.263 billion, up 4.1 percent from $6.975 billion for the first fiscal quarter of 1996. On a comparable store basis, consolidated sales rose 5.5 percent and U.S. Kmart sales rose 5.7 percent for the same period.

"Kmart's sales for the quarter were on plan although April sales were at the low end of expectations," Floyd Hall, chairman, said in a statement. "We did experience a broad decline in traffic beginning in the second week of April, which affected primarily weather-sensitive items such as horticulture and selected apparel areas."
He said the home fashions business was strong, fueled by a strong performance by the Martha Stewart Everyday domestics launch.

Kmart rolled out 110 Big Kmart high frequency store conversions during the month, producing strong performance in consumables. Other areas showing particular strength for the month included do-it-yourself, children's apparel, health and beauty accessories, and photography, Hall said.
Kmart has 2,122 U.S. Kmart retail outlets, and operates 123 stores internationally.
